meanings.definition: laureling (verb): to crown or decorate with laurel
meanings.sent1: She loves laureling her artwork with shiny gold stars.
meanings.sent2: The queen will be laureling the champion of the tournament with a golden wreath.
meanings.sent3: The children were laureling their snowman with colorful scarves and buttons.
meanings.sent4: The chef was laureling the cake with fresh berries, making it look like a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was laureling the entrance with beautiful flowers, creating a welcoming atmosphere.

meanings.definition: laureling (noun): the act of crowning or decorating with laurel
meanings.sent1: The laureling of the hero marked the beginning of the celebration.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the laureling of the winner was met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy interrupted the laureling of the statue by running off with the laurel wreath.
meanings.sent4: The laureling of the tree with fairy lights transformed the garden into a magical wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The artist's delicate laureling of the painting added a touch of elegance to the masterpiece.
